ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so much from this class! Truly exceptional and allowed me to further mostly my speaking and writing skills in German. I have come out of this class feeling very comfortable having day-to-day conversations with Native Speakers and roughly understanding late elementary school reading-level books in German. That is a HUGE accomplishment. This course probably marked the biggest leap in my German knowledge so far. I highly recommend taking it in Berlin/Germany if you can.
Significantly improved my working knowledge of German writing, speaking, hearing and listening. Also gained a deeper awareness of German culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths are EVERYTHING. Great course. Almost no weaknesses. The only weakness is how the exams are structured. They get really boring having the same exact format. It also feels like there's not much you can do to prepare except go over the grammar and vocabulary. Overall, excellent course!
The course is heavily enhanced by its location, and although the structure of the course was intensive, it did not feel too time-consuming, which allowed for other pursuits in Berlin.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES YES!! Especially if you want to improve your German. FLY to Berlin in the summer program and take this class. Also just to be certain I still recommend the course even if you can't do the summer program. It just makes it 100x better:)

Definitely - anyone with a reasonable interest in German should consider the study abroad program. It was a very valuable experience for me - not just for the language skills I gained, but also the ability to explore Berlin.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I plan to become fluent in German so this course was probably the most helpful building block so far in my whole time learning the lanaguage!

I hope to expand my knowledge of German by reading books and watching movies and TV shows. I also hope to return to a German speaking country at some point, definitely for a visit but possibly for the long term.
